017package org.microbean.loader;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.function.Supplier;
022
023import org.microbean.invoke.FixedValueSupplier;
024
025import org.microbean.loader.api.Loader;
026
027import org.microbean.loader.spi.AbstractProvider;
028import org.microbean.loader.spi.Value;
029
030import org.microbean.path.Path;
031import org.microbean.path.Path.Element;
032
033import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
034
035/**
036 * An {@link AbstractProvider} that provides access to {@linkplain
037 * System#getenv(String) environment variables}.
038 *
039 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
040 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
041 */
042public class EnvironmentVariableProvider extends AbstractProvider {
043
044
045
046  /*
047   * Instance fields.
048   */
049
050
051  private final boolean flatKeys;
052
053
054  /*
055   * Constructors.
056   */
057
058
059  /**
060   * Creates a new {@link EnvironmentVariableProvider} that uses flat
061   * keys.
062   *
063   * @see #EnvironmentVariableProvider(boolean)
064   */
065  public EnvironmentVariableProvider() {
066    this(true);
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Creates a new {@link EnvironmentVariableProvider}.
071   *
072   * @param flatKeys whether the key for an environment variable is
073   * derived from a {@link Path}'s {@linkplain Path#lastElement() last
074   * element}'s {@linkplain Element#name() name} only
075   */
076  public EnvironmentVariableProvider(final boolean flatKeys) {
077    super(String.class);
078    this.flatKeys = flatKeys;
079  }
080
081
082  /*
083   * Instance methods.
084   */
085
086
087  /**
088   * If the supplied {@code absolutePath} has a {@linkplain
089   * Path#size() size} of {@code 2} (the {@linkplain Path#root() root}
090   * plus a single name), returns a {@linkplain FixedValueSupplier
091   * deterministic <code>Supplier</code>} whose {@link Supplier#get()}
092   * method returns the {@linkplain System#getenv(String) environment
093   * variable} with that name, or {@code null} in all other cases.
094   *
095   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} requesting a {@link Value};
096   * must not be {@code null}
097   *
098   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
099   * {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
100   *
101   * @return a {@linkplain FixedValueSupplier deterministic} {@link
102   * Supplier} whose {@link Supplier#get()} method returns the
103   * appropriate {@linkplain System#getenv(String) environment
104   * variable} if the supplied {@code absolutePath} has a {@linkplain
105   * Path#size() size} of {@code 2} (the {@linkplain Path#root() root}
106   * plus a single name) and there actually is a {@linkplain
107   * System#getenv(String) corresponding environment variable}; {@code
108   * null} in all other cases
109   *
110   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
111   *
112   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic during
113   * the lifetime of a Java virtual machine instance.
114   *
115   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
116   * threads.
117   *
118   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code requestor} or {@code
119   * absolutePath} is {@code null}
120   *
121   * @see AbstractProvider#find(Loader, Path)
122   *
123   * @see System#getenv(String)
124   */
125  @Override // AbstractProvider
126  protected Supplier<?> find(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
127    assert absolutePath.absolute();
128    assert absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path());
129    assert !absolutePath.equals(requestor.path());
130
131    // On Unix systems, there is absolutely no question that the
132    // environment is entirely immutable, even when probed via
133    // System#getenv(String).  See
134    // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/dfacda488bfbe2e11e8d607a6d08527710286982/src/java.base/unix/classes/java/lang/ProcessEnvironment.java#L67-L91.
135    //
136    // Things are ever so slightly more murky in Windows land.  As of
137    // JDK 17, the environment there is also entirely immutable:
138    // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/dfacda488bfbe2e11e8d607a6d08527710286982/src/java.base/windows/classes/java/lang/ProcessEnvironment.java#L257-L258
139    // but the class is not as "immutable looking" as the Unix one and
140    // it seems to be designed for updating in some cases.
141    // Nevertheless, for the System#getenv(String) case, the
142    // environment is immutable.
143    //
144    // TL;DR: System.getenv("foo") will always return a value for
145    // "foo" if ever there was one, and will always return null if
146    // there wasn't.
147
148    final String value = System.getenv(key(absolutePath, this.flatKeys));
149    if (value == null) {
150      // Environment variables conflate null with absence.
151      return null;
152    }
153    return FixedValueSupplier.of(value);
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Overrides the {@link AbstractProvider#path(Loader, Path)} method
158   * to return a (relative) {@link Path} consisting solely of the
159   * {@linkplain Path#lastElement() last element} of the supplied
160   * {@code absolutePath}.
161   *
162   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} seeking a {@link Value}; must
163   * not be {@code null}
164   *
165   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
166   * <code>Path</code>} for which a {@link Value} is being sought;
167   * must not be {@code null}
168   *
169   * @return a {@link Path} that will be {@linkplain
170   * Value#Value(Supplier, Path) used to build a <code>Value</code>}
171   * to be returned by the {@link #get(Loader, Path)} method
172   *
173   * @nullability This method does not, but overrides may, return
174   * {@code null}.
175   *
176   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
177   * idempotent and deterministic.
178   *
179   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
180   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
181   *
182   * @see AbstractProvider#path(Loader, Path)
183   */
184  @Override // AbstractProvider
185  protected <T extends Type> Path<T> path(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<T> absolutePath) {
186    return Path.of(absolutePath.lastElement());
187  }
188
189
190  /*
191   * Static methods.
192   */
193
194
195  /**
196   * Returns a {@link String} representation of the supplied {@link Path}.
197   *
198   * @param path the {@link Path} in question; must not be {@code
199   * null}
200   *
201   * @param flat whether the key is derived from the supplied {@link
202   * Path}'s {@linkplain Path#lastElement() last element}'s
203   * {@linkplain Element#name() name} only
204   *
205   * @return a {@link String} representation of the supplied {@link
206   * Path}
207   *
208   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
209   *
210   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
211   *
212   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
213   *
214   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
215   * threads.
216   */
217  protected static final String key(final Path<?> path, final boolean flat) {
218    if (flat) {
219      return path.lastElement().name();
220    } else {
221      return path.stream()
222        .map(Element::name)
223        .filter(s1 -> !s1.isEmpty())
224        .reduce((s1, s2) -> String.join(".", s1, s2))
225        .orElse("");
226    }
227  }
228
229}
